discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer: A

questions.question_text: According to TOGAF, which of the following are the architecture domains that are commonly accepted subsets of an overall enterprise architecture?
According to TOGAF, which one of the following best describes an enterprise architecture?

choices.C: An architecture that crosses multiple systems, and multiple functional groups within the enter-prise
choices.B: An architecture that consists of more than one subsidiary company ActualTests.com
choices.A: An architecture of a commercial organization
choices.D: The highest level of architecture that can be achieved in a given organization

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Check 1.3 executive overview \Page 6. It is talking about 
The term "Enterprise" in the context of "Enterprise Architecture" can be applied to either an
entire enterprise, encompassing all of its business activities and capabilities, information, and
technology that make up the entire infrastructure and governance of the enterprise, or to one or
more specific areas of interest within the enterprise. In both cases, the architecture crosses
multiple systems, and multiple functional groups within the enterprise

Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer : C

comments.content:
Correct Answer :C
What is an enterprise?
The term ``enterprise'' in the context of ``enterprise architecture'' can be used to denote both an entire enterprise, encompassing all of its information systems, and a specific domain within the enterprise. In both cases, the architecture crosses multiple systems, and multiple functional groups within the enterprise.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This looks right

questions.question_text: Which one of the following describes classification methods for architecture and solution arti-facts within the Architecture Repository?

comments.content:
Correct Answer:C
2.6 Enterprise Continuum
The Enterprise Continuum is a view of the Architecture Repository that provides methods for classifying architecture and solution artifacts as they evolve from generic Foundation Architectures to Organization-Specific Architectures.

questions.question_text: What part of the Architecture Repository holds specifications to which architectures must conform?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap37.html
37.4.1 
"The Standards Information Base provides a repository area to hold a set of specifications, to which architectures must conform."

questions.question_text:
An association of companies has defined a data model for sharing inventory and pricing information.
Which of the following best describes where this model would fit in the Architecture Continuum?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Industry Architecture

Selected Answer: C
because: An association of companies...

Correct Answer 

Reference : 

Industry Architectures guide the integration of common systems components with industry-specific components, and guide the creation of industry solutions for targeted customer problems within a particular industry.

A typical example of an industry-specific component is a data model representing the business functions and processes specific to a particular vertical industry, such as the Retail industry's "Active Store" architecture, or an Industry Architecture that incorporates the Energistics Data Model (refer to www.energistics.org).
